author: Deepika Bhatt
content: The Madras High Court on Wednesday asked the Tamil Nadu government to hand over keys of AIADMK headquarters to Interim General Secretary Edappadi K Palaniswami, also known as EPS. The court asked AIADMK cadres not to enter the office for one month to prevent untoward incidents. The office was sealed after a clash between supporters of EPS and O Panneerselvam.
title: Hand over AIADMK headquarter keys to EPS: Madras HC to Tamil Nadu govt

author: Atul Mishra
content: Supreme Court on Wednesday said that the issues involved in the petitions over the Shiv Sena crisis might require to be referred to a five-judge bench for consideration. The Speaker will maintain the status quo and not decide on any disqualification of rebel MLAs, SC added. It also directed the Legislative Assembly secretary to keep all records in safe custody.
title: No disqualification of MLAs yet, issue may require a 5-judge bench: SC on Shiv Sena crisis

author: Shiwangi
content: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann has criticised Centre for not giving the state a representation in the panel formed on minimum support price (MSP). "Punjab's farmers are...stuck in crop cycle and debt. MSP is our legal right," he said. Besides members of agricultural universities and central government secretaries, the panel also includes chief secretaries of Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Sikkim and Odisha.
title: Mann criticises Centre for not giving representation to Punjab in MSP panel

author: Swati Dubey
content: Renowned former Olympic track and field athlete PT Usha took oath as Rajya Sabha MP (Member of Parliament) on Wednesday. The government nominated her to the Upper House of the Parliament along with renowned composer Ilaiyaraaja, screenwriter V Vijayendra Prasad and spiritual leader Veerendra Heggade on July 6. Hailing from Kerala, PT Usha is one of India's most iconic sportspersons.
title: Former athlete PT Usha takes oath as Rajya Sabha MP

author: Ashley Paul
content: Mumbai Police have arrested four men for allegedly offering Rahul Kul, BJP MLA from Maharashtra's Daund, a ministerial post for ₹100 crore. Kul met one of the accused in South Mumbai where he bargained to reduce the offer to ₹90 crore. Mumbai Police's Anti Extortion Cell had laid a trap to arrest the accused before their second meeting with Kul.
title: 4 arrested for offering Maha BJP MLA a ministerial post for ₹100 cr

author: Ashley Paul
content: Dinesh Khatik, Minister of State for Jal Shakti in the UP government, has offered his resignation saying department officials didn't listen to him or share information about his ministry. In his resignation letter addressed to Union Home Minister Amit Shah, Khatik claimed he was not kept in the loop by officials. He also alleged widespread corruption in Namami Gange scheme.
title: UP Minister Dinesh Khatik resigns, says officials kept him in the dark

author: Shiwangi
content: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi on Wednesday alleged that PM Narendra Modi is increasing household expenditure while shying away from discussion on it in Parliament. "Is it 'unparliamentary' to discuss inflation?" she tweeted. Priyanka said that the government has increased the burden of inflation by imposing "Grihasthi Satyanash Tax (GST)" (household destruction tax) on grains, jaggery and curd.
title: Is it unparliamentary to discuss inflation?: Priyanka Gandhi to PM Modi

author: Swati Dubey
content: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav shared his take on the resignation of BJP MLA Dinesh Khatik, who alleged that the Yogi government sidelined him as he is a Dalit. "Where you are not respected as a minister but insulted because you're a Dalit, resigning from such a discriminatory BJP government is the only way," he tweeted in Hindi.
title: Resigning only way when not respected: Akhilesh on UP minister's resignation

author: Shiwangi
content: AAP MP Vikramjit Singh Sahney on Wednesday urged the Centre to "be fair" and include representatives from Punjab in the committee constituted on the minimum support price (MSP) along with the Commission for Agricultural Costs & Prices (CACP). Avoiding a dialogue with representatives of Punjab will not serve the purpose, Sahney said.
title: Be fair: AAP MP urges Centre to give representation to Punjab in MSP panel

author: Subhangi Singh
content: BJP MP Smriti Irani criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi by saying that he is adamant to bring down the productivity of Lok Sabha. Referring to Rahul Gandhi, she said, "The person who's been politically unproductive is dedicating himself to ensure there's no debate in Parliament." Rahul's entire political history has been dotted with showing disrespect to Parliamentary procedure, she added.
title: Rahul always disrespected Parliamentary proceedings: Smriti Irani

author: Sakshi Sharma
content: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Wednesday said that the 16th round of talks between India and China on the "border disputes" ended, as expected, without an agreement. "While Indian media reports 'no breakthrough in talks', Chinese media does not even mention the talks," Chidambaram tweeted. "China has conceded nothing on 'Hot Springs'," he added.
title: Chinese media doesn’t even mention ‘talks’: Chidambaram after 16th round of talks

author: Sakshi Sharma
content: Following a female sub-inspector, Sandhya Topno's death after being mowed down by a vehicle in Jharkhand, state BJP MP Sanjay Seth said the law and order has collapsed in the state. "It is a matter of investigation why Sandhya Topno was deployed on night duty. I will raise the issue...in Parliament today," Seth said on Wednesday.
title: Why was she deployed on night duty?: J’khand BJP MP on sub-inspector’s death

author: Sakshi Sharma
content: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma asked all residents to hoist the tricolour between August 13 and 15 at their houses in order to prove that they are "genuine children of Bharat Mata". "Applying for NRC to say that you are Indian citizens is not enough. You have to give proof…Is it or not?" Sarma asked at an event on Tuesday.
title: Hoist tricolour at homes to prove you're genuine children of 'Bharat Mata': Assam CM

author: Nakul Ahuja
content: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Wednesday tweeted a picture of him holding hands with Uddhav Thackeray, and added a couple of lines of Premchand, which says that betrayal is the easiest way out. Raut on Tuesday launched a veiled attack on Twitter at Shinde's faction and said, "Do not leave the forest because of the fear of snakes."
title: Sanjay Raut quotes Premchand, says betrayal is easiest way out

author: Sakshi Sharma
content: On the third day of monsoon session of the Parliament on Wednesday, Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla said the public wants the Parliament to work. His statement came as Lok Sabha was adjourned amid sloganeering by the Opposition MPs today. "I want to tell those members who are indulging in sloganeering that they should take part in discussions," Birla added.
title: Public wants Parliament to work: Om Birla on sloganeering by Oppn

author: Subhangi Singh
content: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi said that the central government is ready for discussion on inflation in Parliament. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is down with COVID and she will reply to questions once she recovers and when Business Advisory Committee decides and both chairs give permission. His statements come after Congress claimed that government is not allowing discussion on GST rates.
title: FM will reply to Opposition's questions once she recovers from COVID: BJP's Joshi

author: Disha Jana
content: BJP MP Arvind Dharmapuri was booked on Wednesday for allegedly abusing Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao. Arvind, who made the alleged comments at an event in Hyderabad last week, was accused of degrading the CM's image and inciting hate towards the state government in the FIR. Notably, Arvind recently alleged that his convoy was attacked by TRS workers.
title: BJP MP Arvind Dharmapuri booked for allegedly abusing T'gana CM

author: Subhangi Singh
content: The Congress party has alleged violation of provisions of the law by NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu in the July 18 election and has filed a complaint with the Election Commission (EC) regarding it. The Karnataka Congress claimed that the BJP "bribed and exerted undue influence" on its MLAs on July 17 and 18 asking them to vote for Murmu.
title: Electoral offences committed by Prez candidate Murmu: Congress to EC

author: Sakshi Sharma
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Wednesday said that it is cruel to raise tax rates when CPI inflation is over 7%. "It is cruel…WPI inflation is over 15%, unemployment is high, the rupee is depreciating, the current account deficit is widening and inflation is expected to rise worldwide," he stated in a thread of tweets.
title: Cruel to raise tax rates when CPI inflation is over 7%: Jairam Ramesh

author: Subhangi Singh
content: The Congress on Wednesday alleged that the PM Narendra Modi-led government is not allowing a discussion in Parliament on the issue of hike in GST on food items. "Government's obstinacy to not permit a debate on the matter has affected Parliament's functioning," Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said. The Modi government is blocking desire of poor and middle class, he added.
title: Parliament's functioning affected due to Modi govt's obstinacy: Congress

author: Nakul Ahuja
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi took a jibe at PM Narendra Modi over GST on packaged food items and said that PM will have to take back the move. "Recipe of Gabbar for people struggling with inflation: Make less, eat less, satisfy hunger with the tadka of jumlas," he said. Packaged food weighing less than 25kg will carry 5% GST.
title: Satisfy hunger with tadka of jumlas: Rahul on GST on essential items

author: Sakshi Sharma
content: As the Opposition has been protesting against inflation, price rise and other issues, Congress leader Shaktisinh Gohil said the onus is on government to ensure smooth functioning of the House. "When BJP was in Opposition, late Arun Jaitley and their other leaders used to say that it was the responsibility of the government…So, the onus is on government," he added.
title: Onus on govt to ensure smooth functioning of House: Congress leader

author: Swati Dubey
content: A video showing Tamil Nadu Rural Development Minister KR Periakaruppan furious after a journalist questioned him about arriving late at an event has gone viral. Periakaruppan reportedly was a few hours late. When a journalist confronted him, he said, "Who waited for three hours? Who gave such an interview? Who waited inside?" He then approached the person recording the video.
title: Video shows TN minister angry as journalist questions him for being late

author: Sakshi Sharma
content: Reacting to Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma’s remark where he asked residents to hoist tricolour at homes to prove they're "genuine children" of 'Bharat Mata', Congress' Manickam Tagore said this shows Sarma's arrogance. "It should be the RSS that must be asked to put tricolour...because, for 52 long years, they didn't put Tiranga at their offices," Tagore added.
title: This shows his arrogance: Cong MP on Assam CM's 'tricolour' remark
